column4: deostroll hmm if you just make the link in /usr/local/bin it will override what's in /usr/bin
that depends on the order in PATH....which comes first
I'm talking about Ubuntu's path setup
I understand...but if the default is changed for some reason....then /usr/bin might come first
Enselic: an ssh server is most definitely not installed by default in Ubuntu
are you sure? I thought they had started including it
I was close <smile> Was looking for the default path....hadn't found /etc/environment yet
puts all the workgroups in a mountpoint...just like browsing the local fiel system
I click on ~/network and see a folder for each workgroup
yeah...made life so much simpler. enter the user/pw in the config file and log into whatever shares you like automatically on login
I will have to tell some people at work about it
just a side note...fuseiso is also nice if you haven't seen it
I used to participate quite a bit here, but have cut back to almost nothing because of attitudes such as kahrytan.
